title: Compiler is being sad: no type for expr in fcx 0x43ed4e0

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Started to learn a bit of rust
Got some error from complier:

```
src\lib.rs:8:24: 8:38 error: type `&mut [T]` does not implement any method in scope named `as_mut_slice`
src\lib.rs:8     let victim = array.as_mut_slice();
                                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
error: internal compiler error: no type for expr in fcx 0x43ed4e0
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', C:/bot/slave/beta-dist-rustc-win-64/build/src/libsyntax\diagnostic.rs:190

stack backtrace:
   1:         0x7120a633 - sys::backtrace::write::h25aa4e11fcc2028f1WC

Code:

```
fn insertion_sort<T: Ord>(array: &mut [T]) {
    let len = array.len();
    let victim = array.as_mut_slice();

    for i in 1..len {
        let value = victim[i];
        let mut j = i - 1;
        while ((j >= 0) && (victim[j] > value)) {
            victim[j+1] = victim[j];
            j -= 1;
        }
        victim[j-1] = value;
    }
}
```

Compiler version:

```
rustc 1.0.0-beta (9854143cb 2015-04-02) (built 2015-04-02)
binary: rustc
